intro: Thunbergia aspera, commonly known as the rough thunbergia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Thunbergia aspera is typically grown as an annual or tender perennial in gardens and greenhouses.
